intro: Polygala monticola var. brizoides, commonly known as the mountain milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. This variant is notable for its ecological importance in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
